appsgate.lig.proxy.google.agenda
Class GoogleAdapter

java.lang.Object
  appsgate.lig.proxy.google.agenda.GoogleAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
AgendaAdapter
public class GoogleAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgendaAdapter

This class is used to communicate, through google calendar API, to Google Agenda web service.

Since:
May 14, 2013
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Cédric Gérard
See Also:
AgendaAdapter

Method Detail

newICal

private net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Calendar newICal()
Initialize a new instance of local ICalendar format

Returns:
an iCalendar java object

getAgenda

public net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Calendar getAgenda(java.lang.String agenda,
                                                   java.lang.String account,
                                                   java.lang.String password,
                                                   java.util.Date startDate,
                                                   java.util.Date endDate)
Get the remote google agenda corresponding to "agenda" with "account" and "password" google account connection If start date is null the getAgenda method return the whole remote agenda, if not it will return the agenda from startDate to the last register event. It is possible to specify a end date to get the agenda between startDate and endDate. If startDate is null the endDate will not be consider.

Specified by:
getAgenda in interface AgendaAdapter
Parameters:
agenda - the remote agenda you want to get
account - the remote service account
password - the password corresponding to the account
startDate - the date from when you want to get events
endDate - the date to when you want to get events
Returns:
the google agenda convert to iCalendar standard format
